poem:
"Shades of Extremism"

Enclosed in columns, words of might,
a tale unfolds in black and white.
Far left to right, in spectral span,
ideals fan out, a spectral fan.
Gove's list unfurls in dawning light,
muslin threads and far-right plight.
Seek not to demonize the "other,"
but recognize each sister, brother.
Midst our hues, let love take flight,
unshackled from fear's stranglehold tight.
